page.title: 16BUCKLAND NEWTON IN 1945
page.content: Employment was good in 1945.The jobs were more or less the same as today. The fuel used was coal, wood, electricity and paraffin lamps. One kind of lamp was a tilly lamp. The entertainment was very different. Instead of T.V. and computers, there were dances.Farming has also changed. Instead of tractors there were horses. The houses were much smaller,with only 2 bedrooms upstairs and a kitchen and washing room downstairs.Some houses had no electricity.The fashion was mid-calf dresses and skirts.The men wore turn- up trousers.Older people wore shawls and hats.Transport was bus,bikes and walking.The village hasn't changed much.There were two small shops but one has been closed down now.At school the children had milk.It was warmed in the Winter.
